comments.body: I would love a Savanna update I really hope 1.20 will add new Savanna mobs like lions who will attack if you go to close into their territory and Lions can breed with a lioness only! or add cheetahs and some type of antelope so we can see a fun cheetah chase in Minecraft! Also make lions hostile to all farm animals and antelope and zebras. Speaking of zebras how about adding a zebra neutral non rideable donkey. Or add a new mob like elephants and maybe you can saddle them and ride them! Also make cheetahs neutral mobs to players. Or how about a giraffe that eats acacia leaves. Or a shy rhino that attacks only if provoked. Or maybe territorial hippos that attack if you hit them or get into or near their water. Or fast ostriches. Or sneaky Bat eared foxes that love to eat termites and shrews and rabbits. Or add a warthog that will come hostile if hit or if a player comes near there piglet. It'll be cool to add monkeys that live in Savannas and Jungles make them steal your dropped items and make them neutral. Also Add leopards that stalk you! Make a rare chance for a black leopard. And make the new frogs naturally spawn in the Savanna. Also make many animals come to drink from the waterhole. Or animal dens or termite hills. The Savannas right now Are a bit boring since there is just some villages some llamas and some farm animals roaming around and acacia wood and some mountains and hills that's it. Minecraft really needs this! Also please add pigeons or crows
Also elephant and giraffes should be added to the savanna.
come on when's the savanna update coming to minecraft
This biome would be perfect for the 1.21 update since they are adding the armadillo!
Add African wild dogs
I LOVE that idea it would be so cute to add even more to the biome with new structures and animals
I like this idea.

There's so much you could add to that, though.
Here's my version of it:

 

Maple logs/wood/planks are sturdier than oak logs, meaning they're more blast resistant and take longer to mine, but beware! They burn just as easy as every other type of wood! I'd imagine the outer bark to be like a grey variant of the oak logs and the inside to be white, so even lighter than birch!

The maple leaves would be redish orange and would create an autumn ambience in the biome they belong to. And just like cherry leaves, they'd have a leaf falling particle effect.

 

Another feature I'd like to be in the maple forest is Duff, the maple variant of Pink Petals. So of course is has to resemble red/orange fallen maple leafs.

 

And instead of the occasional flower patches, Mushrooms are the way to go in this autumn biome.
And maybe for a little more diversity: the Shiitake. A mushroom growing up from the side of maple logs specifically.

 

There's a great chance you'd find spiders in this biome, since they spawn more regularly here than in other biomes. Other creatures I'd see roaming around in such an area are Rabbits and Bats. But also Allays. We all know we can find them in cages of Outposts, but they deserve a natural habitat.

And one last thing: a Tap. It's an item made from 3 iron ingots. 2 placed horizontally and 1 diagonally down from there. It can be placed on maple logs and using a bottle on it will get you maple syrup, like honey, but only for consumption, not for making sticky blocks.
I think the idea is perfect!  Maybe there could also be a Coral Reef variant!
This sounds cool
Amazing idea, it should also connect to a aquifer which could take the player deeper in the caves
ooh, maybe it could be a new source of mycelium and mooshrooms too? Maybe some new mushroom themed mobs, like maybe a new kind of fungal bug/creepy crawler or a bat variant!
The glow shroom could spawn on the surface as well to show where the Fungal Caves are.

I was thinking about this too!!! New and old types of mooshrooms could be seen of all shapes and sizes, I'm feeling a creepy but beautiful look would add a lot to the underground. New mechanics could also be added like a fungos plant that when hit releases poison.
Grass wouldn't grow without sunlight, steel is an artificial alloy, and Blackstone is only in the Nether.
moss instead of grass
New tools for movement (rope, grapple hook, handheld light source.

Con la nueva actualización podrían agregar nuevos mobs al estilo Azteca y/o maya que tengan armas de obsidiana que consigan entrando a las cavernas, y que de vez en cuando te los puedas encontrar y al eliminarlos poder conseguir su arma con una probabilidad del 0.8%
Además de esto también podrían atacarte con sus lanzas al verte, pero al ver que no te han matado de un golpe te consideren un ser superior y te ayuden en las invasiones, además estos mobs podrían tener una especie de danza tribal rezandole a un dios antes de que comience la invasión

The mini-boss could b called the mud monster and throw small along with giant balls of mud at the player. The small balls would do 1 heart of damage and the big balls wood do 3 hearts of damage. Both would cause a blindness effect for 2 seconds. Also instead of a whole biome there could b mud pools that spawn in jungles and caves that would either suffocate u or lead u into a cave

I have no idea what you're really asking for, other than some sort of generated feature that has lava along with rare ores.  Why should it be in the game?  Where would it be?  What would it look like?
Oh, I understand. You're asking for a deeper underground and the lowest region being made up of magma, lava, and precious ore.

Cool idea, but it seems a bit much... Maybe you can rarely find areas like this, but with more than just good ores :)

Ideia Incrível

It would be super awesome if each creaking variant had a different "effect". The default pale creaking are immune to all damage, but the others are killable but have different abilities.
Oak - no abilities, makes an easy fodder enemy for minigames and adventure maps.
Birch - like oak but has higher health and attack.
Spruce - inflicts slowness.
Jungle - inflicts poison.
Acacia - inflicts weakness.
Dark Oak - inflicts darkness.
Warped - teleports itself upon hit.
Crimson - sets you on fire.
Mangrove - inflicts mining fatigue.
Cherry - friendly and heals you.

I agree, coral reefs should be found more often in minecraft, they're beautiful with the sea pickles! It'd be amazing to find one while exploring underwater caves, which are barren right now and needs at least some seaweed or kelp. Coral reefs underwater can be near magma block ravines for warmth.

I just want to point out that, contrary to what a previous post says, coral is not dependent on the sun, and there is coral at the bottom of the ocean. Coral is not a plant. It is a structure created by tiny animals, (kind of like if spiders spun their webs out of bone...)

Mostly balanced, different and awesome, just a few changes I would make:

1. Sky should turn dark/grey near to the biome and maybe black inside it. This telegraphs a danger to new players that they may not be ready for.

2. If a single charged creeper gets near you you're probably dead so i think the risk/reward on this biome needs changing, maybe by making zombie horses more desirable or adding in another reward.

Intriguing, as there is currently no way to get zombie horses. Perhaps Skelton traps can also spawn here(they are the legions of four skeletons with enchanted bows and armor that ride skeleton horses) more commonly

I think the way to go about this is to instead change the portal color to red. There shouldn't be any purple in the nether because that connects it to the End in a way that really doesn't make any sense. See my post "sever connections between nether and end" for more details.
